ArmGroupDescription: Obtain muscle biopsy specimens from young adults (ages 20-40) to develop a millifluidic chip for electrical stimulation of human primary muscle cell hydrogel cultures.
Obtain muscle biopsy specimens from older adults (ages 60-80) to develop a millifluidic chip for electrical stimulation of human primary muscle cell hydrogel cultures.

Short duration electrical will be delivered and the resulting EMG will be recorded. Intensity of electrical stimulation will be progressively increased until we observed a maximal EMG response.

Finally an ultrasound probe (similar to that used for prenatal diagnostic imaging) will be fixed behind your calf in order to visualize muscle.
ArmGroupInterventionName: Other: examination of muscle function and MVC in weightlessness
ArmGroupLabel: high-load resistance training for long term space flights
